intro: Silene parishii var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its pink to purple flowers and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has a short stature, often reaching only a few inches in height, and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
